citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The facility does not have the availability of appropriate equipment and personnel to safely trim long nails on their
wallabies. There are three agile wallabies with extremely long nails, causing their associated toes to twist and turn to the
side. According to the facility, they have been in contact with their attending veterinarian for the past several months
discussing the use of pharmaceutical drugs to facilitate safely trimming the nails without overly stressing the animals.
Currently, they are waiting on their veterinarian to obtain the medication. Animals with excessively long nails can cause
abnormal twisting and pressure on the bones and joints of the toe, leading to unnecessary injury and discomfort in the
animal. Correct by 19 March 2024 by ensuring the facility has a Program of Veterinary Care that adequately provides for
appropriate facilities, personnel, equipment, and or services to maintain all animals in good health and provide for good
welfare.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n
